Delete or replace pages in a PDF

spans.text: Delete or replace pages in a PDF

lines.text: You can replace an entire PDF page with another PDF page. Only the text and images on the

spans.text: You can replace an entire PDF page with another PDF page. Only the text and images on the

lines.text: original page are replaced. Any interactive elements associated with the original page, such as

spans.text: original page are replaced. Any interactive elements associated with the original page, such as

lines.text: links and bookmarks, aren't affected. Likewise, bookmarks and links that may have been

spans.text: links and bookmarks, aren't affected. Likewise, bookmarks and links that may have been

lines.text: previously associated with the replacement page don't carry over. Comments, however, are

spans.text: previously associated with the replacement page don't carry over. Comments, however, are

lines.text: carried over and are combined with any existing comments in the document.

spans.text: carried over and are combined with any existing comments in the document.

lines.text: After you delete or replace pages, it’s a good idea to use the Reduce File Size command to

spans.text: After you delete or replace pages, it’s a good idea to use the

lines.text: Edit Scanned PDFs
Editing a scanned PDF can be complicated if it includes low-quality text or images, non-

spans.text: Editing a scanned PDF can be complicated if it includes low-quality text or images, non-

lines.text: editable text, line breaks, or complex formatting. Other inhibiting factors include compatibility

spans.text: editable text, line breaks, or complex formatting. Other inhibiting factors include compatibility

lines.text: issues, security restrictions, and large file sizes, which are more prevalent in PDFs created from

spans.text: issues, security restrictions, and large file sizes, which are more prevalent in PDFs created from

lines.text: scanned images.
To streamline the process, consider the following best practices and guidelines before editing

spans.text: To streamline the process, consider the following best practices and guidelines before editing

lines.text: a scanned document:
Check the accuracy of optical character recognition (OCR) output . When you open a

spans.text: Check the accuracy of optical character recognition (OCR) output

lines.text: scanned document, Acrobat automatically runs OCR in the background to make the

spans.text: in the background to make the

lines.text: document editable. Before editing, review the document to ensure that the content is

spans.text: document editable. Before editing, review the document to ensure that the content is

lines.text: accurate and complete. If necessary, rescan the document using the Scan & OCR > Recognize

spans.text: accurate and complete. If necessary, rescan the document using the

lines.text: Text
tool to improve the output.
Enhance image quality . If the scanned PDF contains low-quality images, use the Enhance

spans.text: . If the scanned PDF contains low-quality images, use the

lines.text: scanned file or Enhance camera image feature to improve the quality of images before

spans.text: feature to improve the quality of images before

lines.text: attempting to edit the document. For more information, see Scan documents to PDF .

spans.text: attempting to edit the document. For more information, see

lines.text: Use the correct font and formatting . When editing the document, ensure that the font and

spans.text: Use the correct font and formatting
. When editing the document, ensure that the font and

lines.text: formatting of the edited text match the original document as closely as possible. If you don't

spans.text: formatting of the edited text match the original document as closely as possible. If you don't

lines.text: have the desired fonts on your computer, see Add fonts to your computer .

spans.text: have the desired fonts on your computer, see

lines.text: Remove security restrictions . If the scanned PDF has security restrictions that prevent editing,

spans.text: . If the scanned PDF has security restrictions that prevent editing,

lines.text: remove these restrictions before attempting to edit the document. To know how to remove

spans.text: remove these restrictions before attempting to edit the document. To know how to remove

lines.text: security from a PDF, see Unlock a PDF .
Avoid editing complex elements . If the scanned PDF contains tables, graphs, or images,

spans.text: . If the scanned PDF contains tables, graphs, or images,

lines.text: avoid unnecessary edits that could alter the layout or formatting of these elements.

spans.text: avoid unnecessary edits that could alter the layout or formatting of these elements.

lines.text: Check for compatibility issues . Ensure that the version of Adobe Acrobat you're using is

spans.text: . Ensure that the version of Adobe Acrobat you're using is

lines.text: compatible with the scanned PDF. If you encounter compatibility issues, try updating Adobe

spans.text: compatible with the scanned PDF. If you encounter compatibility issues, try updating Adobe

lines.text: Acrobat. For more information, see System requirements .

You can use the Scan & OCR tool to recognize text, change OCR language, and make all

Edit a scanned document
1. Open the scanned PDF file in Acrobat.

spans.text: Open the scanned PDF file in Acrobat.

lines.text: 2. From the global bar in the upper left, select Edit .

spans.text: From the global bar in the upper left, select

lines.text: clear PDFs
You can capture document photos with your smartphone and use the Enhance camera

spans.text: You can capture document photos with your smartphone and use the

lines.text: image feature to create polished, clear, and compact PDFs without needing a standard

spans.text: feature to create polished, clear, and compact PDFs without needing a standard

lines.text: scanner. This feature addresses common issues in mobile-captured images, such as incorrect

spans.text: scanner. This feature addresses common issues in mobile-captured images, such as incorrect

lines.text: perspectives, areas beyond boundaries, shadows, and inconsistent lighting. While it may not

spans.text: perspectives, areas beyond boundaries, shadows, and inconsistent lighting. While it may not

lines.text: Enhance camera image
1. Open the photograph or image of the document in Acrobat.

spans.text: Open the photograph or image of the document in Acrobat.

lines.text: 2. From the All tools menu, select Scan & OCR .
3. From the left panel, select Enhance camera image and then from the dialog that

spans.text: and then from the dialog that

lines.text: Enhance
opens, select .
4. The image is enhanced and a PDF of the image is shown.

spans.text: The image is enhanced and a PDF of the image is shown.

lines.text: 5. (Optional) To further adjust the default enhancement level, drag the Adjust
